document.discussion_title: Arsene Wenger ends transfer chase: Arsenal fans won't like this
document.topic_text: GETTY PURSUIT OVER: Arsenal are no longer chasing Alexandre Lacazette The France international had been a leading target for Arsene Wenger as he looked to add a new striker to his squad. Wenger had turned his attentions to Lacazette after missing out on Leicester star Jamie Vardy, who snubbed a move to the Emirates Stadium to sign a new contract with the Premier League champions. Arsenal had a £29m bid for Lacazette rejected last month and The Times say they have now ended their pursuit of the 25-year-old. Lyon had been adamant that their star striker would not be sold and the Daily Telegraph reported earlier this month that they had raised their asking price to £60m following the Gunners' failed bid. Lacazette has made a blistering start to the new season, scoring five goals in Lyon's first two league games. But with Lacazette also stating his attention to remain at the Parc Olympique Lyonnais , Wenger has now given up on the striker. Related videos
